2023.journals_title: Proceedings on Privacy Enhancing Technologies, Volume 2023

papers.title: Editors' Introduction
papers.authors: Kostas Chatzikokolakis, Aaron Johnson
papers.abstract: Is there currently a crisis of confidence in psychological science reflecting an unprecedented level of doubt among practitioners about the reliability of research findings in the field? It would certainly appear that there is. These doubts emerged and grew as a series of unhappy events unfolded in 2011: the Diederik Stapel fraud case (see Stroebe, Postmes, & Spears, 2012, this issue), the publication in a major social psychology journal of an article purporting to show evidence of extrasensory perception (Bem, 2011) followed by widespread public mockery (see Galak, LeBoeuf, Nelson, & Simmons, in press; Wagenmakers, Wetzels, Borsboom, & van der Maas, 2011), reports by Wicherts and colleagues that psychologists are often unwilling or unable to share their published data for reanalysis (Wicherts, Bakker, & Molenaar, 2011; see also Wicherts, Borsboom, Kats, & Molenaar, 2006), and the publication of an important article in Psychological Science showing how easily researchers can, in the absence of any real effects, nonetheless obtain statistically significant differences through various questionable research practices (QRPs) such as exploring multiple dependent variables or covariates and only reporting these when they yield significant results (Simmons, Nelson, & Simonsohn, 2011). For those psychologists who expected that the embarrassments of 2011 would soon recede into memory, 2012 offered instead a quick plunge from bad to worse, with new indications of outright fraud in the field of social cognition (Simonsohn, 2012), an article in Psychological Science showing that many psychologists admit to engaging in at least some of the QRPs examined by Simmons and colleagues (John, Loewenstein, & Prelec, 2012), troubling new meta-analytic evidence suggesting that the QRPs described by Simmons and colleagues may even be leaving telltale signs visible in the distribution of p values in the psychological literature (Masicampo & Lalande, in press; Simonsohn, 2012), and an acrimonious dust-up in science magazines and blogs centered around the problems some investigators were having in replicating well-known results from the field of social cognition (Bower, 2012; Yong, 2012). Although the very public problems experienced by psychology over this 2-year period are embarrassing to those of us working in the field, some have found comfort in the fact that, over the same period, similar concerns have been arising across the scientific landscape (triggered by revelations that will be described shortly). Some of the suspected causes of unreplicability, such as publication bias (the tendency to publish only positive findings) have been discussed for years; in fact, the phrase file-drawer problem was first coined by a distinguished psychologist several decades ago (Rosenthal, 1979). However, many have speculated that these problems have been exacerbated in recent years as academia reaps the harvest of a hypercompetitive academic climate and an incentive scheme that provides rich rewards for overselling one’s work and few rewards at all for caution and circumspection (see Giner-Sorolla, 2012, this issue). Equally disturbing, investigators seem to be replicating each others’ work even less often than they did in the past, again presumably reflecting an incentive scheme gone askew (a point discussed in several articles in this issue, e.g., Makel, Plucker, & Hegarty, 2012). The frequency with which errors appear in the psychological literature is not presently known, but a number of facts suggest it might be disturbingly high. Ioannidis (2005) has shown through simple mathematical modeling that any scientific field that ignores replication can easily come to the miserable state wherein (as the title of his most famous article puts it) “most published research findings are false” (see also Ioannidis, 2012, this issue, and Pashler & Harris, 2012, this issue). Meanwhile, reports emerging from cancer research have made such grim scenarios seem more plausible: In 2012, several large pharmaceutical companies revealed that their efforts to replicate exciting preclinical findings from published academic studies in cancer biology were only rarely verifying the original results (Begley & Ellis, 2012; see also Osherovich, 2011; Prinz, Schlange, & Asadullah, 2011).
papers.abstract_zh: 目前心理科学是否出现了信任危机，反映出从业者对该领域研究结果的可靠性产生了前所未有的怀疑？显然是有的。随着2011年一系列不愉快事件的发生，这些怀疑出现了，并有所增长:Diederik Stapel欺诈案(见Stroebe，Postmes，& Spears，2012，这一期)，在一份主要的社会心理学杂志上发表了一篇文章，声称显示了超感知觉的证据(Bem，2011)，随后受到了广泛的公开嘲笑(见Galak，LeBoeuf，Nelson，& Simmons，正在出版中；Wagenmakers，Wetzels，Borsboom，& van der Maas，2011)，Wicherts及其同事报告说，心理学家往往不愿意或不能分享他们发表的数据进行再分析(Wicherts，Bakker，& Molenaar，2011；另见Wicherts，Borsboom，Kats，& Molenaar，2006)，以及发表在《心理科学》上的一篇重要文章，该文章表明，在没有任何实际影响的情况下，研究人员可以通过各种有问题的研究实践(qrp)轻松地获得统计学上的显著差异，如探索多个因变量或协变量，并仅在它们产生显著结果时报告这些结果(Simmons，Nelson，& Simonsohn，2011)。对于那些预计2011年的尴尬将很快消失在记忆中的心理学家来说，2012年反而提供了一个从糟糕到更糟糕的快速跳水，在社会认知领域出现了新的明显的欺诈迹象(Simonsohn，2012)，心理科学中的一篇文章显示，许多心理学家承认至少参与了Simmons及其同事检查的一些快速反应程序(John，Loewenstein，& Prelec，2012)。 令人不安的新荟萃分析证据表明，Simmons及其同事描述的qrp甚至可能在心理学文献中的p值分布中留下明显的迹象(Masicampo & Lalande，出版中； Simonsohn，2012)，科学杂志和博客上围绕一些研究人员在复制社会认知领域的知名结果时遇到的问题展开了激烈的争论(Bower，2012；永，2012)。虽然心理学在这两年中所经历的非常公开的问题令我们这些在该领域工作的人感到尴尬，但一些人已经找到了安慰，因为在同一时期，类似的担忧已经在整个科学领域出现(由即将描述的启示引发)。一些不可复制的可疑原因，如发表偏倚(倾向于只发表积极的发现)已经讨论了多年；事实上，抽屉问题这个短语是由一位杰出的心理学家在几十年前首次提出的(Rosenthal，1979)。然而，许多人推测，这些问题在最近几年已经恶化，因为学术界收获了高度竞争的学术氛围和奖励计划，这种奖励计划为过度销售自己的工作提供了丰厚的奖励，而对谨慎和谨慎却几乎没有奖励(见吉纳-索罗拉，2012年，这一期)。同样令人不安的是，研究人员似乎比过去更少地重复彼此的工作，这可能再次反映了一个倾斜的激励机制(这一点在本期的几篇文章中讨论过，例如，马克尔、普吕克尔和赫加蒂，2012)。错误出现在心理学文献中的频率目前还不清楚，但许多事实表明它可能高得令人不安。约安尼迪斯(2005)通过简单的数学建模表明，任何忽视复制的科学领域都很容易陷入悲惨的境地，其中(正如他最著名的文章的标题所言)“大多数发表的研究结果都是错误的”(另见约安尼迪斯，2012，本期，以及Pashler & Harris，2012，本期)。与此同时，来自癌症研究的报告让这种严峻的情景看起来更加可信:2012年，几家大型制药公司透露，他们在癌症生物学方面复制已发表学术研究中令人兴奋的临床前发现的努力很少验证原始结果(Begley & Ellis，2012；另见Osherovich，2011年；普林茨、施朗格和阿萨杜拉，2011年)。
papers.title_zh: 编辑介绍

papers.title: Privacy Rarely Considered: Exploring Considerations in the Adoption of Third-Party Services by Websites
papers.authors: Christine Utz, Sabrina Amft, Martin Degeling, Thorsten Holz, Sascha Fahl, Florian Schaub
papers.title_zh: 很少考虑隐私:探索网站采用第三方服务的考虑因素

papers.title: Not Your Average App: A Large-scale Privacy Analysis of Android Browsers
papers.authors: Amogh Pradeep, Álvaro Feal, Julien Gamba, Ashwin Rao, Martina Lindorfer, Narseo Vallina-Rodriguez, David R. Choffnes
papers.abstract: The transparency and privacy behavior of mobile browsers has remained widely unexplored by the research community. In fact, as opposed to regular Android apps, mobile browsers may present contradicting privacy behaviors. On the one end, they can have access to (and can expose) a unique combination of sensitive user data, from users’ browsing history to permission-protected personally identifiable information (PII) such as unique identifiers and geolocation. However, on the other end, they also are in a unique position to protect users’ privacy by limiting data sharing with other parties by implementing ad-blocking features. In this paper, we perform a comparative and empirical analysis on how hundreds of Android web browsers protect or expose user data during browsing sessions. To this end, we collect the largest dataset of Android browsers to date, from the Google Play Store and four Chinese app stores. Then, we developed a novel analysis pipeline that combines static and dynamic analysis methods to find a wide range of privacy-enhancing (e.g., ad-blocking) and privacy-harming behaviors (e.g., sending browsing histories to third parties, not validating TLS certificates, and exposing PII---including non-resettable identifiers---to third parties) across browsers. We find that various popular apps on both Google Play and Chinese stores have these privacy-harming behaviors, including apps that claim to be privacy-enhancing in their descriptions. Overall, our study not only provides new insights into important yet overlooked considerations for browsers’ adoption and transparency, but also that automatic app analysis systems (e.g., sandboxes) need context-specific analysis to reveal such privacy behaviors.
papers.abstract_zh: 移动浏览器的透明性和隐私行为仍然没有被研究团体广泛探索。事实上，与常规的Android应用程序相反，移动浏览器可能会出现相互矛盾的隐私行为。一方面，他们可以访问(并可以暴露)敏感用户数据的独特组合，从用户的浏览历史到受权限保护的个人身份信息(PII)，如唯一标识符和地理位置。然而，另一方面，他们也处于一个独特的位置，通过实施广告拦截功能来限制与其他方的数据共享，从而保护用户的隐私。在本文中，我们对数百个Android web浏览器如何在浏览会话期间保护或暴露用户数据进行了比较和实证分析。为此，我们从谷歌Play商店和四个中国应用商店收集了迄今为止最大的安卓浏览器数据集。然后，我们开发了一种新颖的分析管道，它结合了静态和动态分析方法，以发现跨浏览器的各种隐私增强(例如，广告拦截)和隐私损害行为(例如，向第三方发送浏览历史记录，不验证TLS证书，以及向第三方暴露PII -包括不可重置的标识符)。我们发现Google Play和中国商店上的各种流行应用程序都有这些损害隐私的行为，包括在其描述中声称增强隐私的应用程序。总的来说，我们的研究不仅为浏览器采用和透明度的重要但被忽视的考虑因素提供了新的见解，而且自动应用分析系统(如沙箱)需要特定于上下文的分析来揭示这种隐私行为。
papers.title_zh: 不是一般的应用程序:对安卓浏览器的大规模隐私分析

papers.title: "Revoked just now!" Users' Behaviors Toward Fitness-Data Sharing with Third-Party Applications
papers.authors: Noé Zufferey, Kavous Salehzadeh Niksirat, Mathias Humbert, Kévin Huguenin
papers.abstract: The number of users of wearable activity trackers (WATs) has rapidly increased over the last decade. Although these devices enable their users to monitor their activities and health, they also raise new security and privacy concerns, given the sensitive data (e.g., steps, heart rate) they collect and the information that can be inferred from this data (e.g., diseases). In addition to sharing with the service providers (e.g., Fitbit), WAT users can share their fitness data with third-party applications (TPAs) and individuals. Understanding how and with whom users share their fitness data and what kind of approaches they take to preserve their privacy are key to assessing the underlying privacy risks and to further designing appropriate privacy-enhancing techniques. In this work, we perform, through a large-scale survey of N=628 WAT users, the first quantitative and qualitative analysis of users' awareness, understanding, attitudes, and behaviors toward fitness-data sharing with TPAs and individuals. By asking these users to draw their thoughts, we explore, in particular, users' practices and actual behaviors toward fitness-data sharing and their mental models. Our empirical results show that about half of WAT users underestimate the number of TPAs to which they have granted access to their data, and 63% share data with at least one TPA that they do not actively use (anymore). Furthermore, 29% of the users do not revoke TPA access to their data because they forget they gave access to it in the first place, and 8% were not even aware they could revoke access to their data. Finally, their mental models, as well as some of their answers, demonstrate substantial gaps in their understanding of the data-sharing process. Importantly, 67% of the respondents think that TPAs cannot access the fitness data that was collected before they granted access to it, whereas TPAs actually can do this.
papers.abstract_zh: 在过去的十年里，可穿戴活动追踪器(WATs)的用户数量迅速增加。虽然这些设备使其用户能够监控他们的活动和健康，但是考虑到他们收集的敏感数据(例如步数、心率)以及可以从这些数据推断的信息(例如疾病)，这些设备也提出了新的安全和隐私问题。除了与服务提供商(例如Fitbit)共享之外，WAT用户还可以与第三方应用程序(TPA)和个人共享他们的健身数据。了解用户如何与谁共享他们的健身数据，以及他们采取什么样的方法来保护他们的隐私，是评估潜在隐私风险和进一步设计适当的隐私增强技术的关键。在这项工作中，我们通过对628名WAT用户的大规模调查，首次对用户对与TPA和个人共享健身数据的认识、理解、态度和行为进行了定量和定性分析。通过要求这些用户画出他们的想法，我们特别探索了用户对健身数据共享的实践和实际行为以及他们的心理模型。我们的实证结果表明，大约一半的WAT用户低估了他们已授权访问其数据的TPA的数量，63%的用户与至少一个他们不再主动使用的TPA共享数据。此外，29%的用户没有撤销对其数据的TPA访问权，因为他们忘记了他们在第一时间给予了访问权，8%的用户甚至不知道他们可以撤销对其数据的访问权。最后，他们的心理模型以及他们的一些回答表明，他们对数据共享过程的理解存在很大差距。重要的是，67%的受访者认为TPAs无法访问在他们被授权访问之前收集的健身数据，而TPAs实际上可以做到这一点。
papers.title_zh: “刚刚撤销了！”用户对与第三方应用共享健身数据的行为

papers.title: On the Privacy Risks of Deploying Recurrent Neural Networks in Machine Learning Models
papers.authors: Yunhao Yang, Parham Gohari, Ufuk Topcu
papers.abstract: We study the privacy implications of training recurrent neural networks (RNNs) with sensitive training datasets. Considering membership inference attacks (MIAs)—which aim to infer whether or not specific data records have been used in training a given machine learning model—we provide empirical evidence that a neural network's architecture impacts its vulnerability to MIAs. In particular, we demonstrate that RNNs are subject to a higher attack accuracy than feed-forward neural network (FFNN) counterparts. Additionally, we study the effectiveness of two prominent mitigation methods for preempting MIAs, namely weight regularization and differential privacy. For the former, we empirically demonstrate that RNNs may only benefit from weight regularization marginally as opposed to FFNNs. For the latter, we find that enforcing differential privacy through either of the following two methods leads to a less favorable privacy-utility trade-off in RNNs than alternative FFNNs: (i) adding Gaussian noise to the gradients calculated during training as a part of the so-called extsc{DP-SGD} algorithm and (ii) adding Gaussian noise to the trainable parameters as a part of a post-training mechanism that we propose. As a result, RNNs can also be less amenable to mitigation methods, bringing us to the conclusion that the privacy risks pertaining to the recurrent architecture are higher than the feed-forward counterparts.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们研究用敏感的训练数据集训练递归神经网络(RNNs)的隐私含义。考虑到成员推理攻击(MIAs)——其目的是推断特定的数据记录是否被用于训练给定的机器学习模型——我们提供了神经网络的架构影响其对MIAs的脆弱性的经验证据。特别地，我们证明了RNNs比前馈神经网络(FFNN)具有更高的攻击精度。此外，我们研究了两个主要的缓解方法的有效性抢占mia，即权重正则化和差分隐私。对于前者，我们从经验上证明，与FFNNs相比，RNNs可能仅从权重正则化中略微受益。对于后者，我们发现，通过以下两种方法中的任何一种实施差分隐私，在RNNs中导致的隐私-效用权衡不如替代FFNNs有利:(I)作为所谓extsc{DP-SGD}算法的一部分，将高斯噪声添加到训练期间计算的梯度中，以及(ii)作为我们提出的后训练机制的一部分，将高斯噪声添加到可训练参数中。因此，rnn也不太容易受到缓解方法的影响，这使我们得出结论:与递归架构相关的隐私风险高于前馈架构。
papers.title_zh: 机器学习模型中使用递归神经网络的隐私风险

papers.title: Blind My - An Improved Cryptographic Protocol to Prevent Stalking in Apple's Find My Network
papers.authors: Travis Mayberry, Erik-Oliver Blass, Ellis Fenske
papers.abstract:
In 2020, Apple introduced the Find My protocol, which allows owners to crowdsource the location of their lost Apple devices even when the lost device has no active internet connection (e.g., Wi-Fi, Cellular). The Find My protocol is the basis for Apple's AirTag tracking tokens which were released later in 2021. In order to prevent malicious use of these tokens, Apple also implemented ``item safety alerts'' which can warn a person if they are being tracked by an AirTag without their knowledge. However, researchers have recently identified several shortcomings with these alerts that allow modified AirTags to track unsuspecting victims indefinitely without being detected. Making matters worse, while recognizing the observed malicious use of AirTags, news reports, Apple's press releases, and their intended anti-tracking improvements to the protocol do not consider the potential surreptitious use of the Find My network by custom built AirTag clones.
In this work, we present an improved Find My protocol which effectively limits the capabilities of malicious AirTags and guarantees that they can be detected while tracking. We accomplish this by adding additional cryptographic verification into the protocol, which restricts tags to only using a bounded set of keys while tracking. In order to maintain - and exceed - the privacy guarantees of the current Find My protocol, we make use of specialized partial blind signatures.
To demonstrate the practicality of this protocol, we implement it end-to-end using a programmable device with the same SoC (nRF52832) as in current AirTags. We also benchmark the cryptographic operations of our protocol and show that they require only modest overhead during the initial pairing procedure.
papers.abstract_zh:
2020年，苹果推出了Find My protocol，允许所有者众包他们丢失的苹果设备的位置，即使丢失的设备没有活跃的互联网连接(例如，Wi-Fi、蜂窝)。Find My协议是2021年晚些时候发布的苹果AirTag跟踪令牌的基础。为了防止恶意使用这些令牌，苹果还实施了“物品安全警报”，如果有人在不知情的情况下被AirTag跟踪，它可以警告他。然而，研究人员最近发现了这些警报的几个缺点，这些警报允许修改后的空中标签无限期地跟踪不知情的受害者而不被检测到。更糟糕的是，虽然认识到观察到的恶意使用AirTag，但新闻报道、苹果的新闻稿以及他们对协议的反跟踪改进并没有考虑到定制的AirTag克隆体对Find My network的潜在偷偷使用。
在这项工作中，我们提出了一个改进的Find My协议，它有效地限制了恶意空中标签的能力，并保证它们可以在跟踪时被检测到。我们通过在协议中添加额外的密码验证来实现这一点，这限制了标签在跟踪时只能使用一组有限的密钥。为了保持并超越当前Find My协议的隐私保证，我们使用了专门的部分盲签名。
为了展示该协议的实用性，我们使用一个可编程器件端到端地实现了该协议，该器件具有与当前AirTags相同的SoC (nRF52832)。我们还对我们的协议的加密操作进行了基准测试，表明它们在初始配对过程中只需要适度的开销。
papers.title_zh: 盲我的-一个改进的加密协议，以防止跟踪苹果的查找我的网络

papers.title: Differentially Private Speaker Anonymization
papers.authors: Ali Shahin Shamsabadi, Brij Mohan Lal Srivastava, Aurélien Bellet, Nathalie Vauquier, Emmanuel Vincent, Mohamed Maouche, Marc Tommasi, Nicolas Papernot
papers.abstract: Sharing real-world speech utterances is key to the training and deployment of voice-based services. However, it also raises privacy risks as speech contains a wealth of personal data. Speaker anonymization aims to remove speaker information from a speech utterance while leaving its linguistic and prosodic attributes intact. State-of-the-art techniques operate by disentangling the speaker information (represented via a speaker embedding) from these attributes and re-synthesizing speech based on the speaker embedding of another speaker. Prior research in the privacy community has shown that anonymization often provides brittle privacy protection, even less so any provable guarantee. In this work, we show that disentanglement is indeed not perfect: linguistic and prosodic attributes still contain speaker information. We remove speaker information from these attributes by introducing differentially private feature extractors based on an autoencoder and an automatic speech recognizer, respectively, trained using noise layers. We plug these extractors in the state-of-the-art anonymization pipeline and generate, for the first time, private speech utterances with a provable upper bound on the speaker information they contain. We evaluate empirically the privacy and utility resulting from our differentially private speaker anonymization approach on the LibriSpeech data set. Experimental results show that the generated utterances retain very high utility for automatic speech recognition training and inference, while being much better protected against strong adversaries who leverage the full knowledge of the anonymization process to try to infer the speaker identity.
papers.abstract_zh: 共享真实世界的语音是培训和部署基于语音的服务的关键。然而，这也增加了隐私风险，因为语音包含大量的个人数据。说话人匿名化旨在从语音话语中删除说话人信息，同时保持其语言和韵律属性不变。最新技术通过从这些属性中解开说话者信息(通过说话者嵌入来表示)并基于另一个说话者的说话者嵌入来重新合成语音。隐私社区的先前研究表明，匿名化通常提供脆弱的隐私保护，更不用说任何可证明的保证了。在这项工作中，我们表明，解开确实不是完美的:语言和韵律属性仍然包含说话人的信息。我们通过引入分别基于使用噪声层训练的自动编码器和自动语音识别器的差分私有特征提取器，从这些属性中去除说话人信息。我们将这些提取器插入到最先进的匿名化管道中，首次生成了私人语音话语，其包含的说话者信息具有可证明的上限。我们在LibriSpeech数据集上对我们的差别隐私说话人匿名化方法产生的隐私和效用进行了经验评估。实验结果表明，所生成的话语对于自动语音识别训练和推断保持了非常高的实用性，同时更好地防止了强大对手利用匿名化过程的全部知识来试图推断说话者身份。
papers.title_zh: 差分私人说话者匿名化

papers.title: TWo-IN-one-SSE: Fast, Scalable and Storage-Efficient Searchable Symmetric Encryption for Conjunctive and Disjunctive Boolean Queries
papers.authors: Arnab Bag, Debadrita Talapatra, Ayushi Rastogi, Sikhar Patranabis, Debdeep Mukhopadhyay
papers.abstract: Searchable Symmetric Encryption (SSE) supports efficient yet secure query processing over outsourced symmetrically encrypted databases without the need for decryption. A longstanding open question has been the following: can we design a fast, scalable, linear storage and low-leakage SSE scheme that efficiently supports arbitrary Boolean queries over encrypted databases? In this paper, we present the design, analysis and prototype implementation of the first SSE scheme that efficiently supports conjunctive, disjunctive and more general Boolean queries (in both the conjunctive and disjunctive normal forms) while scaling smoothly to extremely large encrypted databases, and while incurring linear storage overheads and supporting extremely fast query processing in practice. We quantify the leakage of our proposal via a rigorous cryptographic analysis and argue that it achieves security against a well-known class of leakage-abuse and volume analysis attacks. Finally, we demonstrate the storage-efficiency and scalability of our proposed scheme by presenting experimental results of a prototype implementation of our scheme over large real-world databases.
papers.abstract_zh: 可搜索对称加密(SSE)支持通过外包对称加密数据库进行高效而安全的查询处理，而无需解密。一个长期悬而未决的问题是:我们能否设计一个快速、可伸缩、线性存储和低泄漏的SSE方案，有效地支持加密数据库上的任意布尔查询？在本文中，我们介绍了第一个SSE方案的设计、分析和原型实现，该方案有效地支持合取、析取和更一般的布尔查询(合取和析取范式),同时平滑地扩展到极大的加密数据库，同时招致线性存储开销并在实践中支持极快的查询处理。我们通过严格的密码分析来量化我们的方案的泄漏，并认为它实现了抵抗众所周知的泄漏滥用和容量分析攻击的安全性。最后，我们通过展示我们的方案在大型真实世界数据库上的原型实现的实验结果来展示我们的方案的存储效率和可伸缩性。
papers.title_zh: 二合一SSE:针对合取和析取布尔查询的快速、可扩展和存储高效的可搜索对称加密

papers.title: SoK: Secure Aggregation Based on Cryptographic Schemes for Federated Learning
papers.authors: Mohamad Mansouri, Melek Önen, Wafa Ben Jaballah, Mauro Conti
papers.abstract: Secure aggregation consists of computing the sum of data collected from multiple sources without disclosing these individual inputs. Secure aggregation has been found useful for various applications ranging from electronic voting to smart grid measurements. Recently, federated learning emerged as a new collaborative machine learning technology to train machine learning models. In this work, we study the suitability of secure aggregation based on cryptographic schemes to federated learning. We first provide a formal definition of the problem and suggest a systematic categorization of existing solutions. We further investigate the specific challenges raised by federated learning and analyze the recent dedicated secure aggregation solutions based on cryptographic schemes. We finally share some takeaway messages that would help a secure design of federated learning and identify open research directions in this topic. Based on the takeaway messages, we propose an improved definition of secure aggregation that better fits federated learning.
papers.abstract_zh: 安全聚合包括计算从多个来源收集的数据的总和，而不披露这些单独的输入。已经发现安全聚合对于从电子投票到智能电网测量的各种应用都是有用的。最近，联邦学习作为一种新的协作机器学习技术出现，用于训练机器学习模型。在本文中，我们研究了基于密码方案的安全聚合对联邦学习的适用性。我们首先给出问题的正式定义，并建议对现有解决方案进行系统分类。我们进一步研究了联邦学习提出的具体挑战，并分析了最近基于密码方案的专用安全聚合解决方案。最后，我们分享了一些有助于联合学习的安全设计的信息，并确定了该主题的开放研究方向。基于这些信息，我们提出了一个更适合联合学习的安全聚合的改进定义。
papers.title_zh: SoK:基于联邦学习密码方案的安全聚合

papers.title: Individualized PATE: Differentially Private Machine Learning with Individual Privacy Guarantees
papers.authors: Franziska Boenisch, Christopher Mühl, Roy Rinberg, Jannis Ihrig, Adam Dziedzic
papers.abstract: Applying machine learning (ML) to sensitive domains requires privacy protection of the underlying training data through formal privacy frameworks, such as differential privacy (DP). Yet, usually, the privacy of the training data comes at the cost of the resulting ML models' utility. One reason for this is that DP uses one uniform privacy budget epsilon for all training data points, which has to align with the strictest privacy requirement encountered among all data holders. In practice, different data holders have different privacy requirements and data points of data holders with lower requirements can contribute more information to the training process of the ML models. To account for this need, we propose two novel methods based on the Private Aggregation of Teacher Ensembles (PATE) framework to support the training of ML models with individualized privacy guarantees. We formally describe the methods, provide a theoretical analysis of their privacy bounds, and experimentally evaluate their effect on the final model's utility using the MNIST, SVHN, and Adult income datasets. Our empirical results show that the individualized privacy methods yield ML models of higher accuracy than the non-individualized baseline. Thereby, we improve the privacy-utility trade-off in scenarios in which different data holders consent to contribute their sensitive data at different individual privacy levels.
papers.abstract_zh: 将机器学习(ML)应用于敏感领域需要通过正式的隐私框架(如差分隐私(DP))对底层训练数据进行隐私保护。然而，通常情况下，训练数据的隐私是以ML模型的效用为代价的。其中一个原因是DP对所有训练数据点使用一个统一的隐私预算epsilon，这必须符合所有数据持有者遇到的最严格的隐私要求。在实践中，不同的数据持有者具有不同的隐私要求，并且具有较低要求的数据持有者的数据点可以为ML模型的训练过程贡献更多的信息。考虑到这种需求，我们提出了两种新的基于教师集合私有聚集(PATE)框架的方法来支持具有个性化隐私保证的ML模型的训练。我们正式描述了这些方法，提供了它们的隐私界限的理论分析，并使用MNIST、SVHN和成人收入数据集实验性地评估了它们对最终模型效用的影响。我们的实证结果表明，个性化的隐私方法比非个性化的基线产生更高精度的ML模型。因此，在不同数据持有者同意以不同的个人隐私级别贡献他们的敏感数据的情况下，我们改进了隐私-效用权衡。
papers.title_zh: 个性化PATE:具有个人隐私保证的差异私有机器学习

papers.title: Understanding Person Identification Through Gait
papers.authors: Simon Hanisch, Evelyn Muschter, Admantini Hatzipanayioti, Shu-Chen Li, Thorsten Strufe
papers.abstract: Gait recognition is the process of identifying humans from their bipedal locomotion such as walking or running. As such, gait data is privacy sensitive information and should be anonymized where possible. With the rise of higher quality gait recording techniques, such as depth cameras or motion capture suits, an increasing amount of detailed gait data is captured and processed. The introduction and rise of the Metaverse is an example of a potentially popular application scenario in which the gait of users is transferred onto digital avatars. As a first step towards developing effective anonymization techniques for high-quality gait data, we study different aspects of movement data to quantify their contribution to gait recognition. We first extract categories of features from the literature on human gait perception and then design experiments for each category to assess how much the information they contain contributes to recognition success. We evaluated the utility of gait perturbation by means of naturalness ratings in a user study. Our results show that gait anonymization will be challenging, as the data is highly redundant and inter-dependent.
papers.abstract_zh: 步态识别是从人类的两足运动(如行走或奔跑)中识别人类的过程。因此，步态数据是隐私敏感信息，应尽可能匿名。随着更高质量的步态记录技术的兴起，例如深度相机或动作捕捉服，越来越多的详细步态数据被捕捉和处理。元宇宙的引入和兴起是一个潜在的流行应用场景的例子，其中用户的步态被转移到数字化身上。作为开发高质量步态数据的有效匿名技术的第一步，我们研究了运动数据的不同方面，以量化它们对步态识别的贡献。我们首先从人类步态感知的文献中提取特征类别，然后为每一类别设计实验，以评估它们包含的信息对识别成功的贡献。我们在一项用户研究中通过自然度评定评估了步态扰动的效用。我们的结果表明，步态匿名化将具有挑战性，因为数据是高度冗余和相互依赖的。
papers.title_zh: 通过步态理解个人识别

papers.title: Exploring Model Inversion Attacks in the Black-box Setting
papers.authors: Antreas Dionysiou, Vassilis Vassiliades, Elias Athanasopoulos
papers.abstract: Model Inversion (MI) attacks, that aim to recover semantically meaningful reconstructions for each target class, have been extensively studied and demonstrated to be successful in the white-box setting. On the other hand, black-box MI attacks demonstrate low performance in terms of both effectiveness, i.e., reconstructing samples which are identifiable as their ground-truth, and efficiency, i.e., time or queries required for completing the attack process. Whether or not effective and efficient black-box MI attacks can be conducted on complex targets, such as Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), currently remains unclear. In this paper, we present a feasibility study in regards to the effectiveness and efficiency of MI attacks in the black-box setting. In this context, we introduce Deep-BMI (Deep Black-box Model Inversion), a framework that supports various black-box optimizers for conducting MI attacks on deep CNNs used for image recognition. Deep-BMI’s most efficient optimizer is based on an adaptive hill climbing algorithm, whereas its most effective optimizer is based on an evolutionary algorithm capable of performing an all-class attack and returning a diversity of images in a single run. For assessing the severity of this threat, we utilize all three evaluation approaches found in the literature. In particular, we (a) conduct a user study with human participants, (b) demonstrate our actual reconstructions along with their ground-truth, and (c) use relevant quantitative metrics. Surprisingly, our results suggest that black-box MI attacks, and for complex models, are comparable, in some cases, to those reported so far in the white-box setting.
papers.abstract_zh: 模型反转(MI)攻击旨在为每个目标类恢复语义上有意义的重建，已被广泛研究并证明在白盒设置中是成功的。另一方面，黑盒MI攻击在有效性(即，重构可被识别为其基本事实的样本)和效率(即，完成攻击过程所需的时间或查询)方面表现出低性能。目前尚不清楚是否可以对复杂目标(如卷积神经网络)进行有效和高效的黑盒MI攻击。在本文中，我们提出了一个关于在黑盒设置中MI攻击的有效性和效率的可行性研究。在这种情况下，我们介绍了深度身体质量指数(深度黑盒模型反演)，这是一个支持各种黑盒优化器的框架，用于对用于图像识别的深度CNN进行MI攻击。deep-身体质量指数最有效的优化器是基于自适应爬山算法，而其最有效的优化器是基于一种进化算法，能够在一次运行中执行所有类别的攻击并返回各种图像。为了评估这种威胁的严重性，我们利用了文献中的所有三种评估方法。特别是，我们(a)对人类参与者进行用户研究，(b)展示我们的实际重建及其基本事实，以及(c)使用相关的量化指标。令人惊讶的是，我们的结果表明，在某些情况下，复杂模型的黑盒MI攻击与迄今为止在白盒环境中报告的攻击相当。
papers.title_zh: 探索黑盒环境下的模型反转攻击

papers.title: No Privacy Among Spies: Assessing the Functionality and Insecurity of Consumer Android Spyware Apps
papers.authors: Enze Liu, Sumanth Rao, Sam Havron, Grant Ho, Stefan Savage, Geoffrey M. Voelker, Damon McCoy
papers.abstract: Consumer mobile spyware apps covertly monitor a user's activities (i.e., text messages, phone calls, e-mail, location, etc.) and transmit that information over the Internet to support remote surveillance. Unlike conceptually similar apps used for state espionage, so-called "stalkerware" apps are mass-marketed to consumers on a retail basis and expose a far broader range of victims to invasive monitoring. Today the market for such apps is large enough to support dozens of competitors, with individual vendors reportedly monitoring hundreds of thousands of phones. However, while the research community is well aware of the existence of such apps, our understanding of the mechanisms they use to operate remains ad hoc. In this work, we perform an in-depth technical analysis of 14 distinct leading mobile spyware apps targeting Android phones. We document the range of mechanisms used to monitor user activity of various kinds (e.g., photos, text messages, live microphone access) — primarily through the creative abuse of Android APIs. We also discover previously undocumented methods these apps use to hide from detection and to achieve persistence. Additionally, we document the measures taken by each app to protect the privacy of the sensitive data they collect, identifying a range of failings on the part of spyware vendors (including privacy-sensitive data sent in the clear or stored in the cloud with little or no protection).
papers.abstract_zh: 消费者移动间谍软件应用暗中监视用户的活动(例如，短信、电话、电子邮件、位置等)。)并通过互联网传输该信息以支持远程监控。与概念上类似的用于国家间谍活动的应用不同，所谓的“跟踪软件”应用以零售方式向消费者大量销售，并使更广泛的受害者暴露在侵入性监控之下。如今，这类应用的市场足够大，足以支持数十个竞争对手，据报道，单个供应商监控着数十万部手机。然而，虽然研究界很清楚这类应用的存在，但我们对它们运行机制的理解仍然是临时性的。在这项工作中，我们对针对Android手机的14种不同的领先移动间谍软件应用程序进行了深入的技术分析。我们记录了用于监控各种类型的用户活动(例如，照片、短信、现场麦克风接入)的一系列机制，主要是通过创造性地滥用Android APIs。我们还发现了这些应用程序用来隐藏检测和实现持久性的先前未记录的方法。此外，我们记录了每个应用程序为保护其收集的敏感数据的隐私而采取的措施，确定了间谍软件供应商的一系列失误(包括以明文形式发送的隐私敏感数据或存储在几乎没有或根本没有保护的云中的数据)。
papers.title_zh: 间谍之间没有隐私:评估消费者Android间谍软件应用的功能和不安全性

papers.title: Designing a Location Trace Anonymization Contest
papers.authors: Takao Murakami, Hiromi Arai, Koki Hamada, Takuma Hatano, Makoto Iguchi, Hiroaki Kikuchi, Atsushi Kuromasa, Hiroshi Nakagawa, Yuichi Nakamura, Kenshiro Nishiyama, Ryo Nojima, Hidenobu Oguri, Chiemi Watanabe, Akira Yamada, Takayasu Yamaguchi, Yuji Yamaoka
papers.abstract: For a better understanding of anonymization methods for location traces, we have designed and held a location trace anonymization contest that deals with a long trace (400 events per user) and fine-grained locations (1024 regions). In our contest, each team anonymizes her original traces, and then the other teams perform privacy attacks against the anonymized traces. In other words, both defense and attack compete together, which is close to what happens in real life. Prior to our contest, we show that re-identification alone is insufficient as a privacy risk and that trace inference should be added as an additional risk. Specifically, we show an example of anonymization that is perfectly secure against re-identification and is not secure against trace inference. Based on this, our contest evaluates both the re-identification risk and trace inference risk and analyzes their relationship. Through our contest, we show several findings in a situation where both defense and attack compete together. In particular, we show that an anonymization method secure against trace inference is also secure against re-identification under the presence of appropriate pseudonymization. We also report defense and attack algorithms that won first place, and analyze the utility of anonymized traces submitted by teams in various applications such as POI recommendation and geo-data analysis.
papers.abstract_zh: 为了更好地了解位置跟踪的匿名化方法，我们设计并举办了一场位置跟踪匿名化竞赛，涉及长跟踪(每个用户400个事件)和细粒度位置(1024个区域)。在我们的比赛中，每个团队将她的原始痕迹匿名化，然后其他团队对匿名化的痕迹进行隐私攻击。换句话说，防御和攻击都在一起竞争，这与现实生活中发生的事情很接近。在我们的竞赛之前，我们证明了单独的重新识别不足以作为隐私风险，并且痕迹推断应该作为额外的风险加入。具体来说，我们展示了一个匿名化的例子，它可以完全安全地防止重新识别，但不能防止跟踪推断。基于此，本文对再识别风险和痕迹推理风险进行了评估，并分析了它们之间的关系。通过我们的竞赛，我们展示了在防御和攻击同时竞争的情况下的几个发现。特别地，我们证明了在存在适当的假名化的情况下，防止痕迹推断的匿名化方法也是防止重新识别的。我们还报告了获得第一名的防御和攻击算法，并分析了团队在POI推荐和地理数据分析等各种应用中提交的匿名化跟踪的效用。
papers.title_zh: 设计位置追踪匿名竞赛

papers.title: Detect Your Fingerprint in Your Photographs: Photography-based Multi-Feature Sybil Detection
papers.authors: Yerim Kim, Minjae Kim, Myungjae Chung, Junbeom Hur
papers.abstract: A darknet market is an online marketplace typically implemented over Tor, where vendors sell illegal products or criminal services. Due to dramatic growth in the popularity of such markets, there is a recognized need for automatic investigation of the market’s ecosystem and identification of anonymous vendors. However, as they often create multiple accounts (or Sybil accounts) within or across different marketplaces, detecting Sybil accounts becomes the key to understanding the ecosystem of darknet markets and identifying the actual relationship between the vendors. This study presents a novel Sybil detection method that extracts multiple features of vendors from photographs in a fine-grained level (e.g., image similarity, main category, subcategory, and text data), and reveals the multiple Sybil accounts of them simultaneously. Each feature is extracted from multiple rich sources using an image hash algorithm, Deep Neural Network (DNN) classifier, image restoration, and text recognition tool; and merged using a weighted feature embedding model. The matching score of each vendor is then calculated to identify not only the exact Sybil accounts, but multiple potential accounts suspected of being associated to a single operator. We evaluate the efficacy of our method using real-world datasets from four large darknet markets (i.e., SilkRoad2, Agora, Evolution, Alphabay) from 2014 to 2015. Because of the anonymity of darknet market, we construct the ground-truth of Sybil accounts by randomly splitting the dataset of vendors into two even parts. We used the first set to train the model, and linked the second set to the original vendor in the first set to evaluate performance. Our experimental results demonstrated that the proposed method outperforms the existing photography-based system with an accuracy of 98%, identifying up to 700% more candidate Sybil accounts than prior work. Additionally, our method detects multiple Sybil accounts for 90% of evaluated test cases, presenting a very different picture of darknet marketplace dynamics than methods that can only detect a single Sybil account for each target vendor. Due to its fine-grained multiple feature extraction from photographs, our method can be more generically applied to various darknet markets for Sybil detection regardless of their languages or categories of items.
papers.abstract_zh: 暗网市场是一个典型的通过Tor实现的在线市场，在这里供应商出售非法产品或犯罪服务。由于这种市场的受欢迎程度急剧增长，人们认识到需要自动调查市场的生态系统并识别匿名供应商。然而，由于他们经常在不同市场内或跨不同市场创建多个帐户(或Sybil帐户)，检测Sybil帐户成为了解暗网市场生态系统和确定供应商之间实际关系的关键。这项研究提出了一种新的Sybil检测方法，该方法在细粒度级别上从照片中提取供应商的多个特征(例如，图像相似性、主类别、子类别和文本数据)，并同时显示他们的多个Sybil帐户。使用图像哈希算法、深度神经网络(DNN)分类器、图像恢复和文本识别工具从多个丰富的源中提取每个特征；并使用加权特征嵌入模型进行合并。然后计算每个供应商的匹配分数，以不仅识别准确的Sybil帐户，而且识别怀疑与单个运营商相关联的多个潜在帐户。我们使用2014年至2015年四个大型暗网市场(即SilkRoad2、Agora、Evolution、Alphabay)的真实世界数据集来评估我们方法的有效性。由于暗网市场的匿名性，我们通过将供应商的数据集随机分成两个均匀的部分来构建Sybil账户的基础事实。我们使用第一组来训练模型，并将第二组链接到第一组中的原始供应商来评估性能。我们的实验结果表明，所提出的方法优于现有的基于摄影的系统，准确率为98%，比先前的工作多识别多达700%的候选Sybil账户。此外，我们的方法在评估的测试案例中检测到90%的多个Sybil帐户，与只能检测每个目标供应商的单个Sybil帐户的方法相比，呈现了一幅非常不同的暗网市场动态图。由于其从照片中进行细粒度的多特征提取，我们的方法可以更普遍地应用于各种用于Sybil检测的暗网市场，而不管它们的语言或项目类别。
papers.title_zh: 检测照片中的指纹:基于摄影的多特征Sybil检测

papers.title: StyleID: Identity Disentanglement for Anonymizing Faces
papers.authors: Minh-Ha Le, Niklas Carlsson
papers.abstract: Privacy of machine learning models is one of the remaining challenges that hinder the broad adoption of Artificial Intelligent (AI). This paper considers this problem in the context of image datasets containing faces. Anonymization of such datasets is becoming increasingly important due to their central role in the training of autonomous cars, for example, and the vast amount of data generated by surveillance systems. While most prior work de-identifies facial images by modifying identity features in pixel space, we instead project the image onto the latent space of a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) model, find the features that provide the biggest identity disentanglement, and then manipulate these features in latent space, pixel space, or both. The main contribution of the paper is the design of a feature-preserving anonymization framework, StyleID, which protects the individuals’ identity, while preserving as many characteristics of the original faces in the image dataset as possible. As part of the contribution, we present a novel disentanglement metric, three complementing disentanglement methods, and new insights into identity disentanglement. StyleID provides tunable privacy, has low computational complexity, and is shown to outperform current state-of-the-art solutions.
papers.abstract_zh: 机器学习模型的隐私是阻碍人工智能(AI)广泛采用的剩余挑战之一。本文在包含人脸的图像数据集的背景下考虑这个问题。这类数据集的匿名化正变得越来越重要，因为它们在自动驾驶汽车的训练中发挥着核心作用，以及监控系统产生的大量数据。虽然大多数现有工作通过修改像素空间中的身份特征来消除面部图像的身份，但是我们改为将图像投影到生成对抗网络(GAN)模型的潜在空间上，找到提供最大身份解纠缠的特征，然后在潜在空间、像素空间或两者中操纵这些特征。本文的主要贡献是设计了一个保持特征的匿名化框架StyleID，它在保护个人身份的同时，尽可能多地保留图像数据集中原始人脸的特征。作为贡献的一部分，我们提出了一个新的解开度量，三个互补的解开方法，以及对身份解开的新见解。StyleID提供可调隐私，具有较低的计算复杂度，并显示出优于当前最先进的解决方案。
papers.title_zh: StyleID:用于匿名人脸的身份分离

papers.title: SoK: Secure E-Voting with Everlasting Privacy
papers.authors: Thomas Haines, Rafieh Mosaheb, Johannes Müller, Ivan Pryvalov
papers.abstract: Vote privacy is a fundamental right, which needs to be protected not only during an election, or for a limited time afterwards, but for the foreseeable future. Numerous electronic voting (e-voting) protocols have been proposed to address this challenge, striving for everlasting privacy. This property guarantees that even computationally unbounded adversaries cannot break privacy of past elections. The broad interest in secure e-voting with everlasting privacy has spawned a large variety of protocols over the last three decades. These protocols differ in many aspects, in particular the precise security properties they aim for, the threat scenarios they consider, and the privacy-preserving techniques they employ. Unfortunately, these differences are often opaque, making analysis and comparison cumbersome. In order to overcome this non-transparent state of affairs, we systematically analyze all e-voting protocols designed to provide everlasting privacy. First, we illustrate the relations and dependencies between all these different protocols. Next, we analyze in depth which protocols do provide secure and efficient approaches to e-voting with everlasting privacy under realistic assumptions, and which ones do not. Eventually, based on our extensive and detailed treatment, we identify which research problems in this field have already been solved, and which ones are still open. Altogether, our work offers a well - founded reference point for conducting research on secure e - voting with everlasting privacy as well as for future - proofing privacy in real - world electronic elections.
papers.abstract_zh: 投票隐私是一项基本权利，不仅需要在选举期间或选举后的有限时间内得到保护，而且需要在可预见的未来得到保护。许多电子投票(e-voting)协议已被提出来解决这一挑战，努力争取永久的隐私。这一特性保证了即使是计算能力无限的对手也无法破解过去选举的隐私。在过去的三十年里，对具有永久隐私的安全电子投票的广泛兴趣催生了大量的协议。这些协议在许多方面都有所不同，尤其是它们所针对的确切安全属性、它们所考虑的威胁场景以及它们所采用的隐私保护技术。不幸的是，这些差异往往是不透明的，使得分析和比较很麻烦。为了克服这种不透明的状态，我们系统地分析了所有旨在提供永久隐私的电子投票协议。首先，我们说明了所有这些不同协议之间的关系和依赖性。接下来，我们深入分析了哪些协议在现实假设下提供了安全有效的永久隐私电子投票方案，哪些协议没有。最终，基于我们的广泛和详细的处理，我们识别出在这个领域中哪些研究问题已经被解决，哪些仍然是开放的。总之，我们的工作为研究具有永久隐私的安全电子投票以及现实世界电子选举中的未来隐私保护提供了一个有根据的参考点。
papers.title_zh: SoK:具有永久隐私的安全电子投票

papers.title: Investigating Privacy Decision-Making Processes Among Nigerian Men and Women
papers.authors: Victor Yisa, Reza Ghaiumy Anaraky, Bart P. Knijnenburg, Rita Orji
papers.abstract: The privacy calculus framework and trust heuristics has been used to understand people’s privacy decision-making processes. However, most existing studies are mainly focused on people from developed countries. In this study, we use the privacy calculus in combination with trust heuristics to analyse how people from a developing African nation make decisions. Specifically, we conduct a web-based experiment in which 232 participants from Nigeria used a financial planning prototype app to respond to a number of disclosure questions. We examined how their perceived benefit, perceived sensitivity, and trust in the app influenced their disclosure decisions. In addition, we investigated possible moderating effects of gender and used Partial Least Squares path modelling to analyze our data. Our results show that perceived sensitivity (risks) and perceived benefits influenced the decision-making process of our participants. In addition, women were more likely to change their perception of sensitivity and benefits based on trust, while men were more likely to disclose information based on their perception of benefits. We also found that women were less likely to disclose their information to the app than men. Based on our findings, we make recommendations for educators, financial institutions, designers, and policymakers that aim to raise privacy awareness and design interventions in Nigeria and Africa at large.
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私演算框架和信任试探法已经被用来理解人们的隐私决策过程。然而，大多数现有的研究主要集中在来自发达国家的人。在这项研究中，我们使用隐私演算结合信任试探法来分析来自一个发展中非洲国家的人们如何做决定。具体来说，我们进行了一项基于网络的实验，来自尼日利亚的232名参与者使用财务规划原型应用程序来回答一些披露问题。我们研究了他们对应用程序的感知利益、感知敏感度和信任如何影响他们的披露决定。此外，我们调查了性别可能的调节作用，并使用偏最小二乘路径模型来分析我们的数据。我们的结果表明，感知的敏感性(风险)和感知的利益影响了我们的参与者的决策过程。此外，女性更有可能基于信任改变她们对敏感性和益处的看法，而男性更有可能基于她们对益处的看法披露信息。我们还发现，女性比男性更不愿意向应用程序透露自己的信息。基于我们的发现，我们向教育工作者、金融机构、设计师和决策者提出建议，旨在提高尼日利亚和整个非洲的隐私意识和设计干预措施。
papers.title_zh: 调查尼日利亚男性和女性的隐私决策过程

papers.title: Privacy by Projection: Federated Population Density Estimation by Projecting on Random Features
papers.authors: Zixiao Zong, Mengwei Yang, Justin Ley, Athina Markopoulou, Carter T. Butts
papers.abstract: We consider the problem of population density estimation based on location data crowdsourced from mobile devices, using kernel density estimation (KDE). In a conventional, centralized setting, KDE requires mobile users to upload their location data to a server, thus raising privacy concerns. Here, we propose a Federated KDE framework for estimating the user population density, which not only keeps location data on the devices but also provides probabilistic privacy guarantees against a malicious server that tries to infer users' location. Our approach Federated random Fourier feature (RFF) KDE leverages a random feature representation of the KDE solution, in which each user's information is irreversibly projected onto a small number of spatially delocalized basis functions, making precise localization impossible while still allowing population density estimation. We evaluate our method on both synthetic and real-world datasets, and we show that it achieves a better utility (estimation performance)-vs-privacy (distance between inferred and true locations) tradeoff, compared to state-of-the-art baselines (e.g., GeoInd). We also vary the number of basis functions per user, to further improve the privacy-utility trade-off, and we provide analytical bounds on localization as a function of areal unit size and kernel bandwidth.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们考虑基于移动设备的位置数据众包的人口密度估计问题，使用核密度估计(KDE)。在传统的集中式设置中，KDE要求移动用户将他们的位置数据上传到服务器，因此引发了隐私问题。在这里，我们提出了一个用于估计用户人口密度的联合KDE框架，该框架不仅在设备上保存位置数据，而且还提供概率隐私保证，防止恶意服务器试图推断用户的位置。我们的方法联合随机傅立叶特征(RFF) KDE利用了KDE解决方案的随机特征表示，其中每个用户的信息都不可逆地投影到少量空间非定位的基函数上，使得精确定位成为不可能，同时仍然允许人口密度估计。我们在合成和真实数据集上评估了我们的方法，我们表明，与最先进的基线(例如GeoInd)相比，它实现了更好的效用(估计性能)-隐私(推断和真实位置之间的距离)权衡。我们还改变了每个用户的基函数的数量，以进一步改善隐私-效用的权衡，并且我们提供了作为区域单元大小和内核带宽的函数的定位的分析界限。
papers.title_zh: 投影隐私:通过投影随机特征的联邦人口密度估计

papers.title: HeLayers: A Tile Tensors Framework for Large Neural Networks on Encrypted Data
papers.authors: Ehud Aharoni, Allon Adir, Moran Baruch, Nir Drucker, Gilad Ezov, Ariel Farkash, Lev Greenberg, Ramy Masalha, Guy Moshkowich, Dov Murik, Hayim Shaul, Omri Soceanu
papers.abstract: Privacy-preserving solutions enable companies to offload confidential data to third-party services while fulfilling their government regulations. To accomplish this, they leverage various cryptographic techniques such as Homomorphic Encryption (HE), which allows performing computation on encrypted data. Most HE schemes work in a SIMD fashion, and the data packing method can dramatically affect the running time and memory costs. Finding a packing method that leads to an optimal performant implementation is a hard task. We present a simple and intuitive framework that abstracts the packing decision for the user. We explain its underlying data structures and optimizer, and propose a novel algorithm for performing 2D convolution operations. We used this framework to implement an inference operation over an encrypted HE-friendly AlexNet neural network with large inputs, which runs in around five minutes, several orders of magnitude faster than other state-of-the-art non-interactive HE solutions.
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私保护解决方案使公司能够将机密数据卸载给第三方服务，同时满足政府法规的要求。为了实现这一点，他们利用各种加密技术，如同态加密(HE)，允许对加密数据执行计算。大多数HE方案以SIMD方式工作，数据打包方法会显著影响运行时间和内存开销。找到一种导致最佳性能实现的打包方法是一项艰巨的任务。我们提出了一个简单直观的框架，为用户抽象包装决策。我们解释了它的底层数据结构和优化器，并提出了一种新的算法来执行2D卷积运算。我们使用该框架在一个具有大量输入的加密he友好AlexNet神经网络上实现了一个推理操作，它在大约5分钟内运行，比其他最先进的非交互式HE解决方案快几个数量级。
papers.title_zh: HeLayers:基于加密数据的大型神经网络的Tile Tensors框架

papers.title: Efficient decision tree training with new data structure for secure multi-party computation
papers.authors: Koki Hamada, Dai Ikarashi, Ryo Kikuchi, Koji Chida
papers.abstract: We propose a secure multi-party computation (MPC) protocol that constructs a secret-shared decision tree for a given secret-shared dataset. The previous MPC-based decision tree training protocol (Abspoel et al. 2021) requires $O(2^hmn log n)$ comparisons, being exponential in the tree height $h$ and with $n$ and $m$ being the number of rows and that of attributes in the dataset, respectively. The cause of the exponential number of comparisons in $h$ is that the decision tree training algorithm is based on the divide-and-conquer paradigm, where rows are padded after each split in order to hide the number of rows in the dataset. We resolve this issue via secure data structure that enables us to compute an aggregate value for every group while hiding the grouping information. By using this data structure, we can train a decision tree without padding to rows while hiding the size of the intermediate data. We specifically describes a decision tree training protocol that requires only $O(hmn log n)$ comparisons when the input attributes are continuous and the output attribute is binary. Note that the order is now linear in the tree height $h$. To demonstrate the practicality of our protocol, we implement it in an MPC framework based on a three-party secret sharing scheme. Our implementation results show that our protocol trains a decision tree with a height of 4 in 404 seconds for a dataset of $2^{20}$ rows and 11 attributes.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一个安全的多方计算(MPC)协议，为给定的秘密共享数据集构造一个秘密共享决策树。先前的基于MPC的决策树训练协议(Abspoel等人2021)需要$O(2^hmn log n)$比较，在树高$h$上是指数的，并且$n$和$m$分别是数据集中的行数和属性数。$h$中的比较数量呈指数增长的原因是决策树定型算法基于分治法，即在每次拆分后填充行，以隐藏数据集中的行数。我们通过安全的数据结构来解决这个问题，该数据结构使我们能够计算每个组的聚合值，同时隐藏分组信息。通过使用这种数据结构，我们可以在不填充行的情况下训练决策树，同时隐藏中间数据的大小。我们具体描述了一个决策树训练协议，当输入属性是连续的，输出属性是二进制的时，只需要$O(hmn log n)$比较。请注意，订单现在在树高$h$中是线性的。为了证明我们的协议的实用性，我们在一个基于三方秘密共享方案的MPC框架中实现了它。我们的实现结果表明，我们的协议在404秒内为$2^{20}$行和11个属性的数据集训练了一个高度为4的决策树。
papers.title_zh: 用于安全多方计算的具有新数据结构的高效决策树训练

papers.title: FrodoPIR: Simple, Scalable, Single-Server Private Information Retrieval
papers.authors: Alex Davidson, Gonçalo Pestana, Sofía Celi
papers.abstract: We design FrodoPIR — a highly configurable, stateful, single-server Private Information Retrieval (PIR) scheme that involves an offline phase that is completely client-independent. Coupled with small online overheads, it leads to much smaller amortized financial costs on the server-side than previous approaches. In terms of performance for a database of 1 million 1KB elements, FrodoPIR requires < 1 second for responding to a client query, has a server response size blow-up factor of < 3.6x, and financial costs are ~$1 for answering 100,000 client queries. Our experimental analysis is built upon a simple, non-optimized Rust implementation, illustrating that FrodoPIR is particularly suitable for deployments that involve large numbers of clients.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们设计了FrodoPIR——一个高度可配置的、有状态的、单服务器私有信息检索(PIR)方案，它涉及一个完全独立于客户端的离线阶段。加上较小的在线开销，它导致服务器端的摊余财务成本比以前的方法小得多。就100万个1KB元素的数据库的性能而言，FrodoPIR需要不到1秒的时间来响应客户端查询，服务器响应规模放大系数不到3.6倍，响应100，000个客户端查询的财务成本约为1美元。我们的实验分析建立在一个简单的、非优化的Rust实现之上，说明FrodoPIR特别适合涉及大量客户端的部署。
papers.title_zh: FrodoPIR:简单、可扩展的单服务器私有信息检索

papers.title: 'Surprised, Shocked, Worried'}: User Reactions to Facebook Data Collection from Third Parties
papers.authors: Patricia Arias Cabarcos, Saina Khalili, Thorsten Strufe
papers.abstract: Data collection and aggregation by online services happens to an extent that is often beyond awareness and comprehension of its users. Transparency tools become crucial to inform people, though it is unclear how well they work. To investigate this matter, we conducted a user study focusing on Facebook, which has recently released the 'Off-Facebook Activity' transparency dashboard that informs about personal data collection from third parties. We exposed a group of n = 100 participants to the dashboard and surveyed their level of awareness and reactions to understand how transparency impacts users' privacy attitudes and intended behavior. Our participants were surprised about the massive amount of collected data, became significantly less comfortable with data collection, and more likely to take protective measures. Collaterally, we observed that current consent schemes are inadequate. Based on the survey findings, we make recommendations for more usable transparency and highlight the need to raise awareness about transparency tools and to provide easily actionable privacy controls.
papers.abstract_zh: 在线服务收集和汇总数据的程度往往超出了用户的意识和理解范围。透明度工具对通知人们变得至关重要，尽管尚不清楚它们的效果如何。为了调查此事，我们进行了一项针对脸书的用户研究，该公司最近发布了“脸书以外的活动”透明仪表板，告知从第三方收集个人数据的情况。我们让一组n = 100的参与者接触仪表板，并调查他们的意识水平和反应，以了解透明度如何影响用户的隐私态度和预期行为。我们的参与者对收集的大量数据感到惊讶，对数据收集变得明显不太舒服，更有可能采取保护措施。作为补充，我们观察到当前的同意方案是不充分的。根据调查结果，我们提出了提高透明度的建议，并强调了提高透明度工具意识和提供易于操作的隐私控制的必要性。
papers.title_zh: 惊讶、震惊、担忧' }:用户对从第三方收集脸书数据的反应

papers.title: MIAShield: Defending Membership Inference Attacks via Preemptive Exclusion of Members
papers.authors: Ismat Jarin, Birhanu Eshete
papers.abstract: In membership inference attacks (MIAs), an adversary observes the predictions of a model to determine whether a sample is part of the model’s training data. Existing MIA defenses conceal the presence of a target sample through strong regularization, knowledge distillation, confidence masking, or differential privacy. We propose MIAShield, a new MIA defense based on preemptive exclusion of member samples instead of masking the presence of a member. MIAShield departs from prior defenses in that it weakens the strong membership signal that stems from the presence of a target sample by preemptively excluding it at prediction time without compromising model utility. To that end, we design and evaluate a suite of preemptive exclusion oracles leveraging model confidence, exact/approximate sample signature, and learning-based exclusion of member data points. To be practical, MIAShield splits a training data into disjoint subsets and trains each subset to build an ensemble of models. The disjointedness of subsets ensures that a target sample belongs to only one subset, which isolates the sample to facilitate the preemptive exclusion goal. We evaluate MIAShield on three benchmark image classification datasets. We show that MIAShield effectively mitigates membership inference (near random guess) for a wide range of MIAs; achieves far better privacy/utility trade-off compared with state-of-the-art defenses; and remains resilient in the face of adaptive attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 在成员推理攻击(MIAs)中，对手观察模型的预测，以确定样本是否是模型训练数据的一部分。现有的MIA防御通过强正则化、知识提取、置信度屏蔽或差分隐私来隐藏目标样本的存在。我们提出MIAShield，一种新的MIA防御，它基于成员样本的抢先排除，而不是掩盖成员的存在。MIAShield与以前的防御不同，它通过在预测时先发制人地排除目标样本，而不损害模型的效用，从而削弱了源于目标样本存在的强成员信号。为此，我们设计并评估了一套利用模型置信度、精确/近似样本签名和基于学习的成员数据点排除的抢先排除预言。实际上，MIAShield将训练数据分成不相交的子集，并训练每个子集来建立模型的集合。子集的不连续性确保了目标样本仅属于一个子集，这隔离了样本以促进抢先排除目标。我们在三个基准图像分类数据集上评估MIAShield。我们表明MIAShield有效地减轻了各种mia的成员推断(接近随机猜测);与最先进的防御相比，实现了更好的隐私/效用权衡；并且在面对适应性攻击时保持弹性。
papers.title_zh: MIAShield:通过抢先排除成员来防御成员推理攻击

papers.title: Dynamic Volume-Hiding Encrypted Multi-Maps with Applications to Searchable Encryption
papers.authors: Ghous Amjad, Sarvar Patel, Giuseppe Persiano, Kevin Yeo, Moti Yung
papers.abstract: We study encrypted storage schemes where a client outsources data to an untrusted third-party server (such as a cloud storage provider) while maintaining the ability to privately query and dynamically update the data. We focus on encrypted multi-maps (EMMs), a structured encryption (STE) scheme that stores pairs of label and value tuples. EMMs allow queries on labels and return the associated value tuple. As responses are variable-length, EMMs are subject to volume leakage attacks introduced by Kellaris et al. [CCS'16]. To prevent these attacks, volume-hiding EMMs were introduced by Kamara and Moataz [Eurocrypt'19] that hide the label volumes (i.e., the value tuple lengths). As our main contribution, we present the first fully dynamic volume-hiding EMMs that are both asymptotically and concretely efficient. Furthermore, they are simultaneously forward and backward private which are the de-facto standard security notions for dynamic STE schemes. Additionally, we implement our schemes to showcase their concrete efficiency. Our experimental evaluations show that our constructions are able to add dynamicity with minimal to no additional cost compared to the prior best static volume-hiding schemes of Patel et al. [CCS'19].
papers.abstract_zh: 我们研究加密存储方案，其中客户端将数据外包给不可信的第三方服务器(如云存储提供商)，同时保持私有查询和动态更新数据的能力。我们关注加密多映射(EMMs)，这是一种存储标签和值元组对的结构化加密(STE)方案。EMM允许对标签进行查询，并返回相关的值元组。由于响应是可变长度的，EMM容易受到Kellaris等人[CCS'16]提出的容量泄漏攻击。为了防止这些攻击，Kamara和Moataz [Eurocrypt'19]引入了卷隐藏EMM，隐藏标签卷(即值元组长度)。作为我们的主要贡献，我们提出了第一个完全动态的体积隐藏的EMM，它是渐进的和具体有效的。此外，它们同时是前向和后向私有的，这是动态STE方案事实上的标准安全概念。此外，我们实现我们的方案，以展示他们的具体效率。我们的实验评估表明，与Patel等人[CCS'19]的现有最佳静态体积隐藏方案相比，我们的构造能够以最小的额外成本甚至没有额外成本来增加动态性。
papers.title_zh: 动态体积隐藏加密多重映射及其在可搜索加密中的应用

papers.title: I-GWAS: Privacy-Preserving Interdependent Genome-Wide Association Studies
papers.authors: Túlio A. Pascoal, Jérémie Decouchant, Antoine Boutet, Marcus Völp
papers.abstract: Genome-wide Association Studies (GWASes) identify genomic variations that are statistically associated with a trait, such as a disease, in a group of individuals. Unfortunately, careless sharing of GWAS statistics might give rise to privacy attacks. Several works attempted to reconcile secure processing with privacy-preserving releases of GWASes. However, we highlight that these approaches remain vulnerable if GWASes utilize overlapping sets of individuals and genomic variations. In such conditions, we show that even when relying on state-of-the-art techniques for protecting releases, an adversary could reconstruct the genomic variations of up to 28.6% of participants, and that the released statistics of up to 92.3% of the genomic variations would enable membership inference attacks. We introduce I-GWAS, a novel framework that securely computes and releases the results of multiple possibly interdependent GWASes. I-GWAS continuously releases privacy-preserving and noise-free GWAS results as new genomes become available.
papers.abstract_zh: 全基因组关联研究(GWASes)在一组个体中识别与某一性状(如疾病)统计相关的基因组变异。不幸的是，不小心分享GWAS的统计数据可能会引发隐私攻击。一些作品试图将安全处理与GWASes的隐私保护发布相协调。然而，我们强调，如果GWASes利用重叠的个体和基因组变异，这些方法仍然是脆弱的。在这种情况下，我们表明，即使依靠最先进的技术来保护发布，对手也可以重建高达28.6%的参与者的基因组变异，并且高达92.3%的基因组变异的发布统计数据将支持成员推理攻击。我们介绍了I-GWAS，一个新颖的框架，安全地计算和发布多个可能相互依赖的GWASes的结果。随着新基因组的出现，GWAS不断发布保护隐私和无噪音的GWAS结果。
papers.title_zh: GWAS:保护隐私的相互依赖的全基因组关联研究

papers.title: Is There a Reverse Privacy Paradox? An Exploratory Analysis of Gaps Between Privacy Perspectives and Privacy-Seeking Behaviors
papers.authors: Jessica Colnago, Lorrie Faith Cranor, Alessandro Acquisti
papers.abstract: Privacy scholars have long studied, and argued about, a so-called privacy paradox---the alleged gap between individuals' claims of caring about privacy and their actual behaviors. This manuscript explores whether a different type of mismatch occurs in an online sample of US participants: a mismatch between participants' dismissive perspectives on privacy and their privacy-protective behaviors. In a series of online studies with Prolific US participants we tackle two research questions: is there evidence of mismatches between (dismissive) privacy perspectives, and (protective) privacy behaviors? If so, what can explain those mismatches? In a Behavior Elicitation study, we collect a corpus of privacy-regulating and privacy-protective behaviors. Next, in Study 1, we find evidence that engagement in a broad array of privacy behaviors is, in fact, very common in our sample. We also find that mismatches between dismissive privacy perspectives and protective behaviors emerge in a large proportion of participants. Finally, in Study 2, we uncover several common but distinct reasons for those mismatches, including construing seemingly protective behaviors as motivated by reasons other than privacy, and nuanced stances on when to express privacy concern. Collectively, the results indicate that individuals who are seemingly dismissive of privacy concerns engage in behaviors that can be construed as privacy-seeking. The findings highlight the nuances of individual privacy decision-making and suggest that public policy related to privacy should account for the evidence for widespread privacy-seeking behaviors.
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私学者长期以来一直在研究并争论一个所谓的隐私悖论——即个人声称关心隐私与其实际行为之间的所谓差距。这篇手稿探索了在美国参与者的在线样本中是否出现了不同类型的不匹配:参与者对隐私的不屑一顾的观点和他们保护隐私的行为之间的不匹配。在一系列有大量美国参与者的在线研究中，我们解决了两个研究问题:(轻蔑的)隐私观点和(保护性的)隐私行为之间是否存在不匹配的证据？如果是这样，如何解释这些不匹配？在行为启发研究中，我们收集了一个隐私调节和隐私保护行为的语料库。接下来，在研究1中，我们发现证据表明，在我们的样本中，参与各种隐私行为实际上非常普遍。我们还发现，在很大比例的参与者中出现了不屑一顾的隐私观点和保护行为之间的不匹配。最后，在研究2中，我们揭示了这些不匹配的几个常见但不同的原因，包括将表面上的保护行为解释为由隐私以外的原因所驱动，以及在何时表达隐私问题上的微妙立场。总的来说，研究结果表明，那些看似对隐私问题不屑一顾的人会做出一些可以被理解为寻求隐私的行为。这些发现强调了个人隐私决策的细微差别，并建议与隐私相关的公共政策应该考虑广泛的隐私寻求行为的证据。
papers.title_zh: 是否存在反向隐私悖论？隐私视角与隐私寻求行为差异的探索性分析

papers.title: Privacy Concerns and Acceptance Factors of OSINT for Cybersecurity: A Representative Survey
papers.authors: Thea Riebe, Tom Biselli, Marc-André Kaufhold, Christian Reuter
papers.abstract: The use of Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) to monitor and detect cybersecurity threats is gaining popularity among Cybersecurity Emergency or Incident Response Teams (CERTs/CSIRTs). They increasingly use semi-automated OSINT approaches when monitoring cyber threats for public infrastructure services and incident response. Most of the systems use publicly available data, often focusing on social media due to timely data for situational assessment. As indirect and affected stakeholders, the acceptance of OSINT systems by users, as well as the conditions which influence the acceptance, are relevant for the development of OSINT systems for cybersecurity. Therefore, as part of the ethical and social technology assessment, we conducted a survey (N=1,093), in which we asked participants about their acceptance of OSINT systems, their perceived need for open source surveillance, as well as their privacy behavior and concerns. Further, we tested if the awareness of OSINT is an interactive factor that affects other factors. Our results indicate that cyber threat perception and the perceived need for OSINT are positively related to acceptance, while privacy concerns are negatively related. The awareness of OSINT, however, has only shown effects on people with higher privacy concerns. Here, particularly high OSINT awareness and limited privacy concerns were associated with higher OSINT acceptance. Lastly, we provide implications for further research and the use of OSINT systems for cybersecurity by authorities. As OSINT is a framework rather than a single technology, approaches can be selected and combined to adhere to data minimization and anonymization as well as to leverage improvements in privacy-preserving computation and machine learning innovations. Regarding the use of OSINT, the results suggest to favor approaches that provide transparency to users regarding the use of the systems and the data they gather.
papers.abstract_zh: 使用开源情报(OSINT)来监控和检测网络安全威胁在网络安全应急或事件响应小组(CERTs/CSI rt)中越来越受欢迎。在监控公共基础设施服务的网络威胁和事件响应时，他们越来越多地使用半自动OSINT方法。大多数系统使用公开可用的数据，由于用于情况评估的及时数据，通常侧重于社交媒体。作为间接和受影响的利益攸关方，用户对OSINT系统的接受程度以及影响接受程度的条件与OSINT系统在网络安全方面的发展相关。因此，作为道德和社会技术评估的一部分，我们进行了一项调查(N=1，093)，其中我们询问了参与者对OSINT系统的接受程度、他们对开源监控的感知需求以及他们的隐私行为和担忧。此外，我们测试了对OSINT的认知是否是影响其他因素的交互因素。我们的结果表明，网络威胁感知和对OSINT的感知需求与接受度正相关，而隐私担忧与接受度负相关。然而，对OSINT的认知只对那些更关注隐私的人产生了影响。在这里，特别高的osit意识和有限的隐私关注与更高的osit接受度相关。最后，我们为当局进一步研究和使用OSINT系统进行网络安全提供了启示。由于OSINT是一个框架，而不是单一的技术，因此可以选择和组合各种方法，以坚持数据最小化和匿名化，以及利用隐私保护计算和机器学习创新方面的改进。关于OSINT的使用，研究结果表明，在系统的使用和用户收集的数据方面，支持向用户提供透明度的方法。
papers.title_zh: 网络安全中的隐私问题和接受因素:一项代表性调查

papers.title: Lox: Protecting the Social Graph in Bridge Distribution
papers.authors: Lindsey Tulloch, Ian Goldberg
papers.abstract:
In regions of the world where censorship of the Internet is used to limit access to information, monitor the activity of Internet users, and quash dissent, anti-censorship proxies, or bridges, can offer a connection to the open Internet beyond a censor's area of influence. Bridge distribution systems, built to publicly distribute large pools of bridges to users in censored regions, face the inherent conflict of providing bridges to unknown users when some of them may be malicious. If not designed with care, bridge distribution systems can be quickly overwhelmed by attacks from censors, undermining the integrity of the system and the safety of users. It is therefore crucial to prioritize protecting users when developing such systems.

In this paper, we present a new bridge distribution system, Lox. Lox prioritizes protecting the privacy of users and their social graphs and incorporates enumeration resistance mechanisms to improve access to bridges and limit the malicious behaviour of censors. We use an updated unlinkable multi-show anonymous credential scheme, suitable for a single credential issuer and verifier, to protect Lox bridge users and their social networks from being identified by malicious actors. We formalize a trust level scheme that is compatible with anonymous credentials and effectively limits malicious behaviour while maintaining user anonymity. Our work includes an open-sourced, Rust implementation of our Lox protocols as well as an evaluation of their performance. With reasonable performance and latency for the expected user base of our system, we demonstrate Lox as a practical, social graph protective bridge distribution system.
papers.abstract_zh:
在世界上一些地区，互联网审查被用来限制获取信息、监控互联网用户的活动以及压制异议，反审查代理或桥梁可以在审查者的影响范围之外提供与开放互联网的连接。为向审查区域中的用户公开分发大量网桥而构建的网桥分发系统，面临着向未知用户提供网桥的固有冲突，而这些未知用户中的一些可能是恶意的。如果没有精心设计，桥式配电系统很快就会被审查者的攻击淹没，破坏系统的完整性和用户的安全。因此，在开发此类系统时，优先保护用户至关重要。

本文提出了一种新的桥接分配系统Lox。Lox优先保护用户及其社交图的隐私，并结合了枚举抵抗机制，以改善对桥梁的访问，并限制审查者的恶意行为。我们使用更新的不可链接多显示匿名证书方案，适用于单个证书颁发者和验证者，以保护Lox桥用户和他们的社交网络不被恶意行为者识别。我们形式化了一个信任级别方案，它与匿名证书兼容，并在保持用户匿名的同时有效地限制了恶意行为。我们的工作包括我们的Lox协议的开源Rust实现以及对它们的性能的评估。我们展示了Lox作为一个实用的社会图保护桥分布系统的合理的性能和延迟。
papers.title_zh: Lox:保护桥分布中的社会图

papers.title: How Much Privacy Does Federated Learning with Secure Aggregation Guarantee?
papers.authors: Ahmed Roushdy Elkordy, Jiang Zhang, Yahya H. Ezzeldin, Konstantinos Psounis, Salman Avestimehr
papers.abstract: Federated learning (FL) has attracted growing interest for enabling privacy-preserving machine learning on data stored at multiple users while avoiding moving the data off-device. However, while data never leaves users’ devices, privacy still cannot be guaranteed since significant computations on users’ training data are shared in the form of trained local models. These local models have recently been shown to pose a substantial privacy threat through different privacy attacks such as model inversion attacks. As a remedy, Secure Aggregation (SA) has been developed as a framework to preserve privacy in FL, by guaranteeing the server can only learn the global aggregated model update but not the individual model updates.While SA ensures no additional information is leaked about the individual model update beyond the aggregated model update, there are no formal guarantees on how much privacy FL with SA can actually offer; as information about the individual dataset can still potentially leak through the aggregated model computed at the server. In this work, we perform a first analysis of the formal privacy guarantees for FL with SA. Specifically, we use Mutual Information (MI) as a quantification metric and derive upper bounds on how much information about each user's dataset can leak through the aggregated model update. When using the FedSGD aggregation algorithm, our theoretical bounds show that the amount of privacy leakage reduces linearly with the number of users participating in FL with SA. To validate our theoretical bounds, we use an MI Neural Estimator to empirically evaluate the privacy leakage under different FL setups on both the MNIST and CIFAR10 datasets. Our experiments verify our theoretical bounds for FedSGD, which show a reduction in privacy leakage as the number of users and local batch size grow, and an increase in privacy leakage as the number of training rounds increases. We also observe similar dependencies for the FedAvg and FedProx protocol.
papers.abstract_zh: 联合学习(FL)吸引了越来越多的关注，因为它能够对存储在多个用户处的数据进行隐私保护的机器学习，同时避免将数据移出设备。然而，尽管数据从未离开用户的设备，但隐私仍然无法得到保证，因为对用户训练数据的重要计算是以训练好的本地模型的形式共享的。这些本地模型最近被证明通过不同的隐私攻击(例如模型反转攻击)造成了实质性的隐私威胁。作为一种补救措施，安全聚合(s a)已被开发为在FL中保护隐私的框架，通过保证服务器只能学习全局聚合模型更新而不能学习单个模型更新。虽然SA确保除了聚合模型更新之外，没有关于单个模型更新的附加信息被泄露，但是对于使用SA的FL实际上可以提供多少隐私没有正式的保证；因为关于单个数据集的信息仍然可能通过在服务器处计算的聚集模型泄漏。在这项工作中，我们首先分析了带有SA的FL的形式隐私保证。具体来说，我们使用互信息(MI)作为量化指标，并推导出每个用户的数据集可以通过聚合模型更新泄漏多少信息的上限。当使用FedSGD聚合算法时，我们的理论界限表明，隐私泄漏量随着使用SA参与FL的用户数量线性减少。为了验证我们的理论界限，我们使用MI神经估计器在MNIST和CIFAR10数据集上实证评估了不同FL设置下的隐私泄露。我们的实验验证了FedSGD的理论界限，该界限显示了隐私泄露随着用户数量和本地批量大小的增加而减少，并且隐私泄露随着训练轮数的增加而增加。我们还观察到FedAvg和FedProx协议的类似依赖性。
papers.title_zh: 安全聚合的联合学习保证了多少隐私？

papers.title: Private Multi-Winner Voting for Machine Learning
papers.authors: Adam Dziedzic, Christopher A. Choquette-Choo, Natalie Dullerud, Vinith M. Suriyakumar, Ali Shahin Shamsabadi, Muhammad Ahmad Kaleem, Somesh Jha, Nicolas Papernot, Xiao Wang
papers.abstract: Private multi-winner voting is the task of revealing k-hot binary vectors satisfying a bounded differential privacy (DP) guarantee. This task has been understudied in machine learning literature despite its prevalence in many domains such as healthcare. We propose three new DP multi-winner mechanisms: Binary, Tau, and Powerset voting. Binary voting operates independently per label through composition. Tau voting bounds votes optimally in their L2 norm for tight data-independent guarantees. Powerset voting operates over the entire binary vector by viewing the possible outcomes as a power set. Our theoretical and empirical analysis shows that Binary voting can be a competitive mechanism on many tasks unless there are strong correlations between labels, in which case Powerset voting outperforms it. We use our mechanisms to enable privacy-preserving multi-label learning in the central setting by extending the canonical single-label technique: PATE. We find that our techniques outperform current state-of-the-art approaches on large, real-world healthcare data and standard multi-label benchmarks. We further enable multi-label confidential and private collaborative (CaPC) learning and show that model performance can be significantly improved in the multi-site setting.
papers.abstract_zh: 秘密多赢家投票是揭示满足有界差分隐私(DP)保证的k个热二进制向量的任务。尽管这项任务在医疗保健等许多领域都很普遍，但在机器学习文献中对它的研究不足。我们提出了三种新的DP多赢家机制:二元、Tau和幂集投票。二进制投票通过合成对每个标签独立操作。Tau投票在他们的L2范数下最优地限制投票，以获得紧密的数据独立保证。功效集投票通过将可能的结果视为功效集来对整个二进制向量进行操作。我们的理论和实证分析表明，二元投票在许多任务上可能是一种竞争机制，除非标签之间有很强的相关性，在这种情况下，Powerset投票优于它。我们使用我们的机制，通过扩展规范的单标签技术:PATE，在中心设置中实现隐私保护的多标签学习。我们发现，我们的技术在大规模、真实世界的医疗保健数据和标准的多标签基准上优于当前最先进的方法。我们进一步实现了多标签机密和私人协作(CaPC)学习，并表明模型性能可以在多站点设置中得到显著提高。
papers.title_zh: 机器学习的私人多赢家投票

papers.title: Privacy-Aware Adversarial Network in Human Mobility Prediction
papers.authors: Yuting Zhan, Hamed Haddadi, Afra Mashhadi
papers.abstract: As mobile devices and location-based services are increasingly developed in different smart city scenarios and applications, many unexpected privacy leakages have arisen due to geolocated data collection and sharing. User re-identification and other sensitive inferences are major privacy threats when geolocated data are shared with cloud-assisted applications. Significantly, four spatio-temporal points are enough to uniquely identify 95% of the individuals, which exacerbates personal information leakages. To tackle malicious purposes such as user re-identification, we propose an LSTM-based adversarial mechanism with representation learning to attain a privacy-preserving feature representation of the original geolocated data (i.e., mobility data) for a sharing purpose. These representations aim to maximally reduce the chance of user re-identification and full data reconstruction with a minimal utility budget (i.e., loss). We train the mechanism by quantifying privacy-utility trade-off of mobility datasets in terms of trajectory reconstruction risk, user re-identification risk, and mobility predictability. We report an exploratory analysis that enables the user to assess this trade-off with a specific loss function and its weight parameters. The extensive comparison results on four representative mobility datasets demonstrate the superiority of our proposed architecture in mobility privacy protection and the efficiency of the proposed privacy-preserving features extractor. We show that the privacy of mobility traces attains decent protection at the cost of marginal mobility utility. Our results also show that by exploring the Pareto optimal setting, we can simultaneously increase both privacy (45%) and utility (32%).
papers.abstract_zh: 随着移动设备和基于位置的服务在不同的智能城市场景和应用中日益发展，由于地理定位数据收集和共享，出现了许多意想不到的隐私泄露。当地理定位数据与云辅助应用程序共享时，用户重新识别和其他敏感推断是主要的隐私威胁。值得注意的是，四个时空点足以唯一识别95%的个人，这加剧了个人信息泄露。为了解决恶意目的，例如用户重新识别，我们提出了一种基于LSTM的对抗机制，通过表示学习来获得原始地理定位数据(即移动性数据)的隐私保护特征表示，以用于共享目的。这些表示旨在以最小的效用预算(即损失)最大限度地减少用户重新识别和完整数据重建的机会。我们通过量化移动数据集在轨迹重建风险、用户重新识别风险和移动可预测性方面的隐私-效用权衡来训练该机制。我们报告了一个探索性的分析，使用户能够用一个特定的损失函数及其权重参数来评估这种权衡。在四个有代表性的移动数据集上的大量比较结果证明了我们提出的体系结构在移动隐私保护方面的优越性以及我们提出的隐私保护特征提取器的有效性。我们证明了移动痕迹的隐私以边际移动效用为代价获得了体面的保护。我们的结果还表明，通过探索帕累托最优设置，我们可以同时增加隐私(45%)和效用(32%)。
papers.title_zh: 人体移动预测中的隐私感知对抗网络

papers.title: Exploring privacy implications of awareness and control mechanisms in smart home devices
papers.authors: Madiha Tabassum, Heather Lipford
papers.abstract: Smart home users have a variety of controls they can use to configure their devices according to their preferences. However, it is unclear how people utilize these controls, what considerations they make, and the implications of those decisions for users' privacy. To address this gap, we have conducted two complimentary interview studies regarding the controls available for configuring, monitoring, and sharing collected information in two common smart home devices: a smart doorbell and a lock. We interviewed 21 non-owner participants in the lab and 18 owners of these devices over the phone. While both novice users and existing owners were primarily driven by desired functionality while setting up their devices, their configuration decisions impact what data gets collected and how that data and the device are used and shared. Our findings suggest a range of opportunities to improve the privacy-related features and support for smart home devices.
papers.abstract_zh: 智能家居用户可以根据自己的喜好使用各种控件来配置设备。然而，还不清楚人们如何利用这些控制，他们做出什么考虑，以及这些决定对用户隐私的影响。为了弥补这一差距，我们进行了两项免费的访谈研究，内容涉及两种常见智能家居设备(智能门铃和锁)中可用于配置、监控和共享收集信息的控件。我们在实验室采访了21名非所有者参与者，并通过电话采访了这些设备的18名所有者。虽然新手用户和现有用户在设置他们的设备时主要受所需功能的驱动，但他们的配置决策会影响收集哪些数据以及如何使用和共享这些数据和设备。我们的发现提出了一系列改进智能家居设备隐私相关功能和支持的机会。
papers.title_zh: 探索智能家居设备中感知和控制机制的隐私含义

papers.title: Dolphin: A Cellular Voice Based Internet Shutdown Resistance System
papers.authors: Piyush Kumar Sharma, Rishi Sharma, Kartikey Singh, Mukulika Maity, Sambuddho Chakravarty
papers.abstract: Traditional censorship revolves around blocking access to some websites (or services) over the Internet. However, recently there has been a rise in the events of an extreme form of censorship viz., deliberate Internet shutdown, leading to complete Internet disconnection, severely impacting lives in such regions. Naturally, these shutdowns render all existing circumvention schemes unusable. Thus, we present Dolphin, a first of its kind system that can provide access to lightweight and delay tolerant Internet applications (email, tweets, news snippets, etc.) during Internet shutdowns. Dolphin uses the cellular voice channel to transmit data bits. A user in the shutdown region (who wishes to access these applications) requires a peer in non-shutdown region to send and retrieve content on its behalf. The data bits between the peers are sent by first encoding them into audio and then transmitting them over a cellular voice call. We overcome multiple challenges while designing and implementing Dolphin. E.g., the cellular voice channel is inherently lossy and unreliable. But the Internet applications need reliable transfers. Thus, in Dolphin we develop a TCP-style reliability layer to overcome the losses that works atop any underlying encoding and modulation scheme. Further, to evade eavesdroppers over the insecure voice channel, we provide end-to-end confidentiality. Also, Dolphin can function even without human intervention, by using cellular voice automation services. We experimentally show that Dolphin works for Internet applications, by testing it for sending email, tweets and accessing news snippets. All these applications take a few minutes to be accessed (e.g., a 500 character email was received in under 2 minutes).
papers.abstract_zh: 传统的审查围绕着阻止访问互联网上的一些网站(或服务)。然而，最近出现了一种极端形式的审查事件，即。故意关闭互联网，导致互联网完全断开，严重影响这些地区的生活。自然，这些关闭使得所有现有的规避方案都无法使用。因此，我们提出了Dolphin，它是同类系统中的第一个，可以提供对轻量级和延迟容忍的互联网应用程序(电子邮件、推文、新闻片段等)的访问。)在互联网关闭期间。Dolphin使用蜂窝语音信道传输数据位。关闭区域中的用户(希望访问这些应用程序)要求非关闭区域中的对等体代表其发送和检索内容。对等体之间的数据位通过首先将它们编码成音频，然后通过蜂窝语音呼叫传输它们来发送。在设计和实现Dolphin时，我们克服了多重挑战。例如，蜂窝语音信道固有地有损耗并且不可靠。但是互联网应用需要可靠的传输。因此，在Dolphin中，我们开发了一个TCP风格的可靠性层，以克服在任何底层编码和调制方案上工作的损失。此外，为了避开不安全语音信道上的窃听者，我们提供了端到端的保密性。此外，通过使用蜂窝语音自动化服务，Dolphin甚至可以在没有人类干预的情况下工作。通过测试Dolphin发送电子邮件、推文和访问新闻片段，我们实验性地展示了Dolphin适用于互联网应用。所有这些应用程序都需要几分钟才能被访问(例如，不到两分钟就收到一封500个字符的电子邮件)。
papers.title_zh: Dolphin:一种基于蜂窝语音的互联网防关机系统

papers.title: Multi-Party Replicated Secret Sharing over a Ring with Applications to Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning
papers.authors: Alessandro N. Baccarini, Marina Blanton, Chen Yuan
papers.abstract: Secure multi-party computation has seen significant performance advances and increasing use in recent years. Techniques based on secret sharing offer attractive performance and are a popular choice for privacy-preserving machine learning applications. Traditional techniques operate over a field, while designing equivalent techniques for a ring Z_2^k can boost performance. In this work, we develop a suite of multi-party protocols for a ring in the honest majority setting starting from elementary operations to more complex with the goal of supporting general-purpose computation. We demonstrate that our techniques are substantially faster than their field-based equivalents when instantiated with a different number of parties and perform on par with or better than state-of-the-art techniques with designs customized for a fixed number of parties. We evaluate our techniques on machine learning applications and show that they offer attractive performance.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，安全多方计算取得了显著的性能进步，并得到了越来越多的应用。基于秘密共享的技术提供了有吸引力的性能，并且是保护隐私的机器学习应用的流行选择。传统技术在一个领域内运行，而为环形Z_2^k设计等效的技术可以提高性能。在这项工作中，我们开发了一套在诚实多数环境下的多方协议，从初等运算到更复杂的运算，目标是支持通用计算。我们证明，当用不同数目的参与方实例化时，我们的技术比它们的基于场的等效技术快得多，并且在为固定数目的参与方定制设计的情况下，性能与最先进的技术相当或更好。我们在机器学习应用程序上评估了我们的技术，并表明它们提供了有吸引力的性能。
papers.title_zh: 环上多方复制秘密共享及其在隐私保护机器学习中的应用

papers.title: Efficient Proofs of Software Exploitability for Real-world Processors
papers.authors: Matthew Green, Mathias Hall-Andersen, Eric Hennenfent, Gabriel Kaptchuk, Benjamin Perez, Gijs Van Laer
papers.abstract: We consider the problem of proving in zero-knowledge the existence of vulnerabilities in executables compiled to run on real-world processors. We demonstrate that it is practical to prove knowledge of real exploits for real-world processor architectures without the need for source code and without limiting our consideration to narrow vulnerability classes. To achieve this, we devise a novel circuit compiler and a toolchain that produces highly optimized, non-interactive zero-knowledge proofs for programs executed on the MSP430, an ISA commonly used in embedded hardware. Our toolchain employs a highly optimized circuit compiler and a number of novel optimizations to construct efficient proofs for program binaries. To demonstrate the capability of our system, we test our toolchain by constructing proofs for challenges in the Microcorruption capture the flag exercises.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们考虑在零知识条件下证明在真实处理器上运行的可执行程序中存在漏洞的问题。我们证明了在不需要源代码和不将我们的考虑限制在狭窄的漏洞类别的情况下，证明对真实世界处理器架构的真实利用的知识是可行的。为了实现这一目标，我们设计了一种新颖的电路编译器和工具链，为在MSP430上执行的程序生成高度优化的非交互式零知识证明，MSP 430是嵌入式硬件中常用的ISA。我们的工具链使用了一个高度优化的电路编译器和一些新颖的优化来构造程序二进制文件的有效证明。为了展示我们系统的能力，我们通过在微腐败捕获标志练习中构建挑战证据来测试我们的工具链。
papers.title_zh: 真实处理器软件可开发性的有效证明

papers.title: Editors' Introduction
papers.authors: Kostas Chatzikokolakis, Aaron Johnson
papers.abstract: Is there currently a crisis of confidence in psychological science reflecting an unprecedented level of doubt among practitioners about the reliability of research findings in the field? It would certainly appear that there is.
